    Enrichment

    enrichment.Rmd

    Term Enrichment

    Term enrichment analysis is possible proceeding an expression analysis with the enrichment() function, employing either the GSEA algorithm or a simple Wilcoxon rank sum comparison, and can be visualized with the plot_enrichment() function.

    library("dplyr")
library("tidyproteomics")

rdata <- hela_proteins %>% 
  normalize(.method = 'linear') %>%
  expression(knockdown/control) %>%
  enrichment(knockdown/control, 
             .term = 'biological_process', 
             .method = 'wilcoxon')

    Exporting Results

    The results of this analysis are stored in the tidyproteomics data-object and can easily be exported to save as a flat data table or used in an external down stream analysis.

    
rdata %>% export_analysis(knockdown/control, 
                          .analysis = 'enrichment', 
                          .term = 'biological_process')
#> # A tibble: 13 × 5
#>    annotation                         p_value adj_p_value enrichment  size
#>    <chr>                                <dbl>       <dbl>      <dbl> <int>
#>  1 conjugation                      0.0000213    0.000277    -2.76    1227
#>  2 cell proliferation               0.000292     0.00350      7.58     301
#>  3 development                      0.00653      0.0719      -3.51     879
#>  4 cellular component movement      0.0172       0.172        2.84    1015
#>  5 cell organization and biogenesis 0.0249       0.224        0.264   1373
#>  6 defense response                 0.0590       0.472       -0.996    848
#>  7 cell differentiation             0.109        0.765        2.31     551
#>  8 metabolic process                0.151        0.907        0.615   3179
#>  9 coagulation                      0.168        0.907       -0.0803   961
#> 10 cell communication               0.441        1            0.371    157
#> # ℹ 3 more rows

    The results can also have any other terms appended to the output, such as protein or gene_name, which may be useful for follow-on analyses.

    
rdata %>% export_analysis(knockdown/control, 
                          .analysis = 'enrichment', 
                          .term = 'biological_process',
                          .append = 'gene_name')
#> # A tibble: 13 × 6
#>    annotation                    p_value adj_p_value enrichment  size gene_names
#>    <chr>                           <dbl>       <dbl>      <dbl> <int> <chr>     
#>  1 conjugation                   2.13e-5    0.000277    -2.76    1227 DYNC1H1, …
#>  2 cell proliferation            2.92e-4    0.00350      7.58     301 PRKDC, HU…
#>  3 development                   6.53e-3    0.0719      -3.51     879 PRKDC, FL…
#>  4 cellular component movement   1.72e-2    0.172        2.84    1015 PRKDC, PR…
#>  5 cell organization and biogen… 2.49e-2    0.224        0.264   1373 PRKDC, FL…
#>  6 defense response              5.90e-2    0.472       -0.996    848 PLEC, PRK…
#>  7 cell differentiation          1.09e-1    0.765        2.31     551 PLEC, DYN…
#>  8 metabolic process             1.51e-1    0.907        0.615   3179 PLEC, AHN…
#>  9 coagulation                   1.68e-1    0.907       -0.0803   961 PLEC, FAS…
#> 10 cell communication            4.41e-1    1            0.371    157 TLN1, DSP…
#> # ℹ 3 more rows

    Enrichment Plot 

    
rdata %>% plot_enrichment(knockdown/control, 
                          .term = 'biological_process')
